snippet: The earnings at Sony reflect a revival in the fortunes of other struggling Japanese electronics manufacturers, and its shares have surged almost 60 percent in 2013.
abstract: Sony reports loss of 10.7 billion yen, or $114 million, in three months that ended Dec 2012, its fiscal third quarter, up from loss of 158 billion yen in year-ago period; cites weak currency that helped compensate for disappointing electronics sales.
lead_paragraph: The earnings at Sony reflect a revival in the fortunes of other struggling Japanese electronics manufacturers, and its shares have surged almost 60 percent in 2013.

headline.main: Weaker Yen Helps Sony Trim Losses for Quarter
